gdi1shisen.test
Interface ShisenTest

All Known Implementing Classes:
ShisenTestAdapter
public interface ShisenTest

All public unit tests access your implementation using methods of this interface exclusively. You have to provide an implementation of ShisenTestAdapter to map the methods of this interface to you implementation.

               throws java.lang.Exception

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - in case the level is not syntactically correct

getBrickAt

java.lang.String getBrickAt(int x,
                            int y)
Returns the current brick value at the given position. Remember that the value is " " (space) if the brick has been removed.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate
y - The Y coordinate
Returns:
Brick value at the given position

currentLevelToString

java.lang.String currentLevelToString()
Returns the String representation of the current level. Note: Remove all spaces and line feeds from the string. The resulting string is a concatenation of each row in the level.

Returns:
the String representation

java.lang.String getBestPlayerName()

writeHighScoreFile

void writeHighScoreFile()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Tells the Shisen implementation to write the current highscores to disk, as detailed in the documentation.

Throws:
If - an error occurred during writing.
java.lang.Exception

createHighscoreEntry

void createHighscoreEntry(java.lang.String name,
                          int time)
Creates a new entry in the highscore list with the specified name and time. The resulting list is sorted by the times (shortest time, first entry).

Parameters:
name - Name of the player.
time - Time that the player needed to solve the level.

Save game state to a file.

Parameters:
file - The file to save the game state in.

Load game state from a file.

Parameters:
file - The file with the desired game state.

Returns whether the current level is solved.

canBeRemoved

boolean canBeRemoved(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2)
Returns true, if the bricks at (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) can be legally removed.

Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of brick 1
y1 - Y coordinate of brick 1
x2 - X coordinate of brick 2
y2 - Y coordinate of brick 2
Returns:
True if the bricks at the given positions can be legally removed, otherwise false.

removeBricks

void removeBricks(int x1,
                  int y1,
                  int x2,
                  int y2)
Removes the two bricks at the given positions (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).

Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of brick 1
y1 - Y coordinate of brick 1
x2 - X coordinate of brick 2
y2 - Y coordinate of brick 2

getHint

int[][] getHint()
Returns a pair of xy-coordinates (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) where the corresponding bricks can be legally removed within the current state. Returns null if no move is possible within the current state.

Returns:
2d-int-array A as follows: A[0][0]=x1, A[0][1]=y1, A[1][0]=x2, A[1][1]=y2,

getSolution

int[][][] getSolution()
Returns a solution as a sequence of xy-coordinates (x1,y1) and (x2,y2). Returns null if the game is not solvable within the current state.

Returns:
3d-int-array A as follows: A[i][0][0]=x1, A[i][0][1]=y1, A[i][1][0]=x2, A[i][1][1]=y2 with i = 0,1,2,...,n
